[#What is an Email Sequence?]

[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271263]
An email sequence is a number of emails scheduled to be sent in a specific timeframe where each one serves a different purpose. It is essentially a series of automated marketing emails.

bit.body: An email sequence is a number of emails scheduled to be sent in a specific timeframe where each one serves a different purpose. It is essentially a series of automated marketing emails.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271264]
Otherwise known as an ‘autoresponder’, an email sequence plays a huge role in your email marketing strategy and describes a series of emails that are sent out to your audience at a timely and methodically manner.

bit.body: Otherwise known as an ‘autoresponder’, an email sequence plays a huge role in your email marketing strategy and describes a series of emails that are sent out to your audience at a timely and methodically manner.

bitmark:
[.articlebitmark++]
[@id:271265]
Email sequences have some obvious and hidden benefits attached to them.

• They nurture your leads and forms better relationships
• They ensure your email leads get the best of your content at any time they join
• They provide valuable information and advice to your audience
• They create a unique personalized experience to your leads
• They automate your marketing efforts (selling your courses while you sleep!)

bit.body:

[#Different Types of Emails and Sequences]

bit.title: Different Types of Emails and Sequences

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271269]
There are many types of email sequences and the differences are found in the goal of your each email campaign.

bit.body: There are many types of email sequences and the differences are found in the goal of your each email campaign.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271270]
What it includes and urges your email list members to do is directly associated with what you want to do and your business goals.

bit.body: What it includes and urges your email list members to do is directly associated with what you want to do and your business goals.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark++]
[@id:271271]
Each sequence might have a different purpose like:

• Welcoming new students
• Informing with news, tips and blog posts
• Nurturing leads (from a free course or a ==lead magnet==|https://support.learnworlds.com/support/solutions/articles/12000055492-offer-a-freebie-as-a-lead-magnet| to buy a course 
• Launching a new course
• Engaging in conversation

Each sequence might have a different purpose like:

• Welcoming new students
• Informing with news, tips and blog posts

• Launching a new course
• Engaging in conversation

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271272]
Each email you send out needs to follow a specific plan of action and a goal which will potentially bring your leads one step closer to ‘closing the deal’ or in marketing terms, ‘making the sale’.

bit.body: Each email you send out needs to follow a specific plan of action and a goal which will potentially bring your leads one step closer to ‘closing the deal’ or in marketing terms, ‘making the sale’.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271273]
For example...
**Do you want people to get to know more about what you do?** Then, you can create an email that links to your site - either your course description or blog.

bit.body:
For example...
**Do you want people to get to know more about what you do?** Then, you can create an email that links to your site - either your course description or blog.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271274]
**Do you want people to build trust in your product?** You can create an email that links out to customer reviews and testimonials.

bit.body: **Do you want people to build trust in your product?** You can create an email that links out to customer reviews and testimonials.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271275]
**Do you want people to engage with you in a more direct way?** Create an email inviting them to join a webinar or a podcast talking about your course.

[@id:271276]

[@id:271279]
1. What’s awesome about sequence emails is that you get to write them ONCE and then you ==choose an email marketing tool==|https://www.learnworlds.com/email-automation-online-courses/| that will send them out to subscribers directly, and... your job is done!

2. Don’t forget to setup your ==email notifications in Learnworlds==|https://support.learnworlds.com/support/solutions/articles/5000692672-notifications|. They are also part of your email sequence welcoming new users, students, customers and customizing the whole learn- ing experience.

2. Don’t forget to setup your ==email notifications in Learnworlds==|https://support.learnworlds.com/support/solutions/articles/5000692672-notifications|. They are also part of your email sequence welcoming new users, students, customers and customizing the whole learn- ing experience.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271280]
Each email sequence can include multiple different kinds of emails to engage your audience in different ways, leading them to the final desired result.

bit.body: Each email sequence can include multiple different kinds of emails to engage your audience in different ways, leading them to the final desired result.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271281]
To guide your way through different types of email sequences, in this article we present the most prevailing ones that you will need as a course instructor.

bit.body: To guide your way through different types of email sequences, in this article we present the most prevailing ones that you will need as a course instructor.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271282]
[%THE ‘WELCOME’ EMAIL]
An email that welcomes new members to your online community. It usually provides them with an incentive to explore your online school and purchase your courses. Also, informing email subscribers about what they expect to see in your emails and how useful is being a member of the email list - presenting the benefits.

bit.body: An email that welcomes new members to your online community. It usually provides them with an incentive to explore your online school and purchase your courses. Also, informing email subscribers about what they expect to see in your emails and how useful is being a member of the email list - presenting the benefits.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271283]
[%THE QUESTION EMAIL]
This is the email that aims to entice and attract attention. It takes the form of the ‘helpful email’ and lending them a hand - letting them know that you are there for them and building on awareness.

bit.body: This is the email that aims to entice and attract attention. It takes the form of the ‘helpful email’ and lending them a hand - letting them know that you are there for them and building on awareness.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271284]
[%THE NEWSLETTER EMAIL]
An encouraging email that urges subscribers to check out your blog content, your videos/webinars, read and share your school’s or industry news, learn about new features or try out alternative solutions you provide.

bit.body: An encouraging email that urges subscribers to check out your blog content, your videos/webinars, read and share your school’s or industry news, learn about new features or try out alternative solutions you provide.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271285]
[%THE ‘ANNOUNCEMENT’ EMAIL]
A notifying email that informs subscribers for news and updates.
For example:
a) **Course Launch** - announcing the launch of your course (date/day) - countdown, providing a course outline and focusing on the benefits it offers.
b) **Course Registration Open Call** - encouraging them to take a pick in your course, linking to your course page description and offering an open call to course enrolment/pre-registration.
c) **Feature Update** - letting know subscribers about the launch of a new feature or access to new course material.

bit.body:
A notifying email that informs subscribers for news and updates.
For example:
a) **Course Launch** - announcing the launch of your course (date/day) - countdown, providing a course outline and focusing on the benefits it offers.
b) **Course Registration Open Call** - encouraging them to take a pick in your course, linking to your course page description and offering an open call to course enrolment/pre-registration.
c) **Feature Update** - letting know subscribers about the launch of a new feature or access to new course material.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271286]
[%THE ‘OFFER/BONUS’ EMAIL]
A specialized targeted email that promotes an offer the email subscribers can claim within a limited-time, encouraging them to take new steps (get their coupon codes, download an ebook, join a VIP webinar etc.)

bit.body: A specialized targeted email that promotes an offer the email subscribers can claim within a limited-time, encouraging them to take new steps (get their coupon codes, download an ebook, join a VIP webinar etc.)

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271287]
[%THE ‘LAST CHANCE’ EMAIL]
This is similar to abandoning cart email that is used on retail sites - ‘Claim Your Spot’ providing a ‘Last Call’ to indecisive people.

bit.body: This is similar to abandoning cart email that is used on retail sites - ‘Claim Your Spot’ providing a ‘Last Call’ to indecisive people.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271288]
[%THE ‘PRODUCT REVIEW’ EMAIL]
The email that asks your email subscribers, students or community for constructive feedback and reviews on your product.

bit.body: The email that asks your email subscribers, students or community for constructive feedback and reviews on your product.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271289]
[%THE ‘NURTURE’ EMAIL]
An email that helps your subscribers get to know you better. It usually shares industry or company news and informs them on what’s going on ‘behind the scenes’.

bit.body: An email that helps your subscribers get to know you better. It usually shares industry or company news and informs them on what’s going on ‘behind the scenes’.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271290]
[%THE ‘RE-ENGAGEMENT’ EMAIL]
An email that is designed to ‘win back’ your subscribers and regenerate their interest in your product. It usually sends out a reminder or a warning that you are going to unsubscribe inactive users. This could also be packed with a unique offer.

bit.body: An email that is designed to ‘win back’ your subscribers and regenerate their interest in your product. It usually sends out a reminder or a warning that you are going to unsubscribe inactive users. This could also be packed with a unique offer.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271291]
[%THE ‘THANK YOU’ EMAIL]
This is the email that sends out a ‘thank you’ note to subscribers for being loyal, supporting your school and taking an active role in the learning community.

bit.body: This is the email that sends out a ‘thank you’ note to subscribers for being loyal, supporting your school and taking an active role in the learning community.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271292]
These are just a few types of emails you can send out to your subscribers once you set your email marketing strategy up and running. Each one is used with a certain purpose in mind and helps to serve your business needs.

bit.body: These are just a few types of emails you can send out to your subscribers once you set your email marketing strategy up and running. Each one is used with a certain purpose in mind and helps to serve your business needs.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271293]
On that note, you should make sure to create emails that use the best and most appropriate visuals that go with it and match with your brand. Apart from designing good-quality photos, you need to come up with a catchy marketing copy, and choose your colours and graphics carefully.

bit.body: On that note, you should make sure to create emails that use the best and most appropriate visuals that go with it and match with your brand. Apart from designing good-quality photos, you need to come up with a catchy marketing copy, and choose your colours and graphics carefully.

[#How to Set up Your Email Sequence]

bit.title: How to Set up Your Email Sequence

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271296]
Your email sequence could be about any topic, but it should always relate to your school’s subject and online courses. After all, it needs to create awareness and get people interested into what you are offering.

bit.body: Your email sequence could be about any topic, but it should always relate to your school’s subject and online courses. After all, it needs to create awareness and get people interested into what you are offering.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271297]
To help you create a winning email sequence, there are a few steps you need to take into account...

bit.body: To help you create a winning email sequence, there are a few steps you need to take into account...

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271298]
[%Step 1: Name the sequence]
Naming the sequence can give you the pointers you need to create your sequence. In a way, it sets up the context and prepares the ground for it, it keeps you focused and driven to your goal.

bit.body: Naming the sequence can give you the pointers you need to create your sequence. In a way, it sets up the context and prepares the ground for it, it keeps you focused and driven to your goal.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271299]
The name of your sequence describes what it is going to come up in the next emails, and can easily become the headline/subject line of your email.

bit.body: The name of your sequence describes what it is going to come up in the next emails, and can easily become the headline/subject line of your email.

a) Step-by-Step Guide on how to Get Fit in 30 days [Sports/Fitness]
b) Mastering the Science of Social Media: Your Very Own Free Toolkit [Business/Digital Marketing]
c) Best Strategies on How to Ace Your Next Job Interview [Job Search/Career Advice]

[@id:271301]
[%Step 2: Set up the sequence]
==Each autoresponder tool==|https://www.learnworlds.com/email-automation-online-courses/| has different guidelines as to how you can set up your sequence, however they all follow a ‘standard route’ to it.

bit.body: ==Each autoresponder tool==|https://www.learnworlds.com/email-automation-online-courses/| has different guidelines as to how you can set up your sequence, however they all follow a ‘standard route’ to it.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271302]
First, create the sequence and give it the name you have decided for it. Then finish your email draft and complete your email series. Decide when you want each email to go out to your list of subscribers - these could only be a group of subscribers or everyone. Finally, click save and you are ready to go.

bit.body: First, create the sequence and give it the name you have decided for it. Then finish your email draft and complete your email series. Decide when you want each email to go out to your list of subscribers - these could only be a group of subscribers or everyone. Finally, click save and you are ready to go.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:271303]
[%Step 3: Set time to the content]
Your email sequence starts as soon as each subscriber enters your email list. It’s up to you to decide how many days after the subscription you want these emails to be sent out. What’s great is that no email content is lost and each subscriber receives it on the days scheduled e.g. Day 1, Day 3, Day 5 and so on.

bit.body: Your email sequence starts as soon as each subscriber enters your email list. It’s up to you to decide how many days after the subscription you want these emails to be sent out. What’s great is that no email content is lost and each subscriber receives it on the days scheduled e.g. Day 1, Day 3, Day 5 and so on.
bit.item: Step 3: Set time to the content

DAY 1 Email 1
**Email Subject: I have a great announcement to make.**
Date: 7 May 2019
Hi Emma,
After spending years on how to write a CV effectively, you may have concluded that no amount of drafts are good to be sent out to employers or even close enough to what you have dreamed for.
But, it doesn’t have to be that way.
Searching for a job can become an exhausting process, and the burden to come up with the perfect CV to impress employers it’s painstaking. I know exactly how you feel. I have been there, and somewhere in the process I have decided to give an end to that.
Check out my video:
[image & Link to the video]
This is why I have decided to create a career-changing course that will help you land your dream job through the write-up of an awesome CV that will stand out from the competition.
Today, I am really excited to introduce you to my new course ‘How to Write a CV That Gets the Job’ that is starting in 3 days from now, on May 9th at 12:00 noon to be exact!
So, keep an eye on your inbox to see the course opening soon! Talk soon! :)
Kyriaki
CV & Career Coach

LAST TIPS FOR WRITING GREAT EMAIL SEQUENCES
1. **Think of your goals before writing the email**: decide what you want your subscribers to do and write an email serving that specific purpose.

2. **Use evergreen content**: send out messages that don’t expire and are relevant to your subscribers at any time and place.

3. **Stay simple**: the most effective emails are short, straight-to- the-point and are written in plain text.

4. **Be personal**: apart from the recipients’ name, you can use personalized tags to create a more personalized content.

5. **Reflect your own brand**: your text and design should match with the feel of your website and make sure to show off your course effectively - in a positive light.

6. **Come up with effective subject lines**: think about FOMO 6 subject lines, ones that spark curiosity, are funny, offer a solution to a problem on the spot and share social proof/stats.

4. **Be personal**: apart from the recipients’ name, you can use personalized tags to create a more personalized content.

5. **Reflect your own brand**: your text and design should match with the feel of your website and make sure to show off your course effectively - in a positive light.

6. **Come up with effective subject lines**: think about FOMO 6 subject lines, ones that spark curiosity, are funny, offer a solution to a problem on the spot and share social proof/stats.
